title: Crohn114_genomic DNA from peripheral blood 2
characteristics_ch1.3: atnf usage at time of phlebotomy: No
extract_protocol_ch1: Peripheral blood was drawn and stored in EDTA to prevent coagulation. Erythrocytes were lysed before proteins were aggregated out of the sample. Genomic DNA was extracted through ethanol precipitation, after which the DNA was dissolved in tris-ethylenediaminetetraacetic buffer (Tris-EDTA) and stored at 4°C.
hyb_protocol: Bisulfite converted DNA was hybridized to Illumina Infinium Human Methylation450k Beadchip using standard Illumina protocol
scan_protocol: Arrays were imaged using BeadArray Reader using standard recommended Illumina scanner setting
data_processing: Minfi (v1.16.0) for reading the data; MethylAid (v1.14.0) for quality control - Due to failing the QC, samples Crohn100, Crohn32 and Crohn75 were removed from the processed data
data_processing.1: non_normalized.txt contains unmethylated and methylated signal intensities
data_processing.2: Average M values normalized using the functional normalization method implemented in minfi
